thread.title: Rangers in playoffs, near AL West title after edging Angels
thread.title_full: Rangers in playoffs, near AL West title after edging Angels

author: SCHUYLER DIXON
title: Rangers in playoffs, near AL West title after edging Angels
text:
Tony Gutierrez Rangers in playoffs, near AL West title after edging Angels 
Texas Rangers' Adrian Beltre points to the dugout whiles standing on second after hitting a bases learning double off of Los Angeles Angels' Andrew Heaney in the fifth inning of a baseball game Thursday, Oct. 1, 2015, in Arlington, Texas. (AP Photo/Tony Gutierrez) Tony Gutierrez Rangers in playoffs, near AL West title after edging Angels 
Texas Rangers starting pitcher Derek Holland delivers to the Los Angeles Angels in the first inning of a baseball game Thursday, Oct. 1, 2015, in Arlington, Texas. (AP Photo/Tony Gutierrez) Tony Gutierrez Rangers in playoffs, near AL West title after edging Angels 
Los Angeles Angels' Albert Pujols follows through on a double to center off a pitch from Texas Rangers' Derek Holland in the second inning of a baseball game Thursday, Oct. 1, 2015, in Arlington, Texas. (AP Photo/Tony Gutierrez) Tony Gutierrez Rangers in playoffs, near AL West title after edging Angels 
Los Angeles Angels starting pitcher Andrew Heaney works against the Texas Rangers in the first inning of a baseball game Thursday, Oct. 1, 2015, in Arlington, Texas. (AP Photo/Tony Gutierrez) Tony Gutierrez Rangers in playoffs, near AL West title after edging Angels 
Texas Rangers left fielder Josh Hamilton (32) reaches up to grab a sacrifice fly by Los Angeles Angels' Shane Victorino in the second inning of a baseball game that scored Albert Pujols Thursday, Oct. 1, 2015, in Arlington, Texas. (AP Photo/Tony Gutierrez) Tony Gutierrez Rangers in playoffs, near AL West title after edging Angels 
Texas Rangers left fielder Josh Hamilton slam against the lower wall after grabbing a sacrifice fly by Los Angeles Angels' Shane Victorino in the second inning of a baseball game that scored Albert Pujols Thursday, Oct. 1, 2015, in Arlington, Texas. (AP Photo/Tony Gutierrez) Tony Gutierrez Rangers in playoffs, near AL West title after edging Angels 
Texas Rangers' Robinson Chirinos is unable to tag out Los Angeles Angels' Albert Pujols (5) who scored on a sacrifice fly by Shane Victorino in the second inning of a baseball game Thursday, Oct. 1, 2015, in Arlington, Texas. Home plate umpire Quinn Wolcott watches the play. (AP Photo/Tony Gutierrez) Tony Gutierrez Rangers in playoffs, near AL West title after edging Angels 
Texas Rangers' Adrian Beltre (29) follows through on a bases clearing double that came off a pitch from Los Angeles Angels' Andrew Heaney in the fifth inning of a baseball game Thursday, Oct. 1, 2015, in Arlington, Texas. Angels catcher Carlos Perez watches the hit. (AP Photo/Tony Gutierrez) Tony Gutierrez Rangers in playoffs, near AL West title after edging Angels 
Texas Rangers' Shin-Soo Choo of South Korea points to Adrian Beltre standing on second after Beltre's bases clearing double in the fifth inning of a baseball game against the Los Angeles Angels Thursday, Oct. 1, 2015, in Arlington, Texas. Choo, Delino DeShields and Robinson Chirinos scored on the hit. (AP Photo/Tony Gutierrez) Posted: Thursday, October 1, 2015 11:27 pm Rangers in playoffs, near AL West title after edging Angels Associated Press | 0 comments 
ARLINGTON, Texas (AP) â€” The Texas Rangers clinched a wild-card spot and moved to the cusp of the AL West title, with Adrian Beltre's three-run double backing Derek Holland in a 5-3 victory over the Los Angeles Angels on Thursday night. 
The Rangers (87-72), in the playoffs for the first time since 2012 after a 95-loss season, are a win or a Houston loss away from their first division title since winning two straight and going to the World Series in 2010-11. 
The Angels can't defend their AL West championship, but still have a shot at the second wild card with three games left. Los Angeles (83-76) is a game behind the Astros and tied with Minnesota, which beat Cleveland 4-2. 
Holland (4-3) allowed three hits and three runs in 6 1-3 innings for his first win since Sept. 5.
